final_answer.precision_note: Charge Q = I × t = 1.50 A × (30.0 × 60) s = 1.50 × 1800 = 2700 C. Moles of electrons n(e-) = Q / F = 2700 / 96500 = 0.02798 mol. Moles of Cu = 0.02798 / 2 = 0.01399 mol. Mass of Cu = 0.01399 × 63.55 = 0.889 g (3 significant figures).

method: First calculate the total charge passed: Convert time to seconds: 30.0 min = 30.0 × 60 = 1800 s. Calculate charge: Q = I × t = 1.50 A × 1800 s = 2700 C. Calculate moles of electrons: n(e-) = Q / F = 2700 C / 96500 C mol-1 = 0.027979 mol. From the half-equation Cu2+ + 2e- → Cu, 2 moles of electrons produce 1 mole of Cu. So moles of Cu = n(e-) / 2 = 0.027979 / 2 = 0.013989 mol. Calculate mass of copper deposited: m = n × atomic mass = 0.013989 mol × 63.55 g mol-1 = 0.889 g.
